Responsibilities: H-E-B Digital builds the tech that feeds Texas. Come join us at H-E-B Digital and be a partner in building the next generation of digital innovations that enhance how Texans find inspiration from food, make food decisions, and ultimately get food into their homes. We’re using the best available technologies to deliver modern, engaging, reliable, and scalable experiences to meet the evolving needs of our growing audience. Our digital solutions are growing in popularity and adoption—like Curbside and Home Delivery—so you’ll get the opportunity to define the user experience for millions of customers and hundreds of thousands of Partners. If you’re someone who enjoys collaborating with engineers with diverse backgrounds and skills to solve new challenges, working in a dynamic environment, learning new skills, and applying it all to solve large and impactful business problems, we want you as part of our team. This is an exciting time to join H-E-B Digital, and we’re hiring across the stack: front-end web and mobile, full-stack, and backend engineering. For more information, visit digital.heb.com At H-E-B, we hire first for problem-solving and growth mindset. We do not expect you to have experience with all of these technologies; a few specific experiences and a desire to learn in this direction are most important. If you are in doubt, please apply anyway! What we are looking for Enthusiastic individuals looking for fun, camaraderie, challenges, and opportunities to mentor others while growing their career 2+ years of application development experience We work most often with Java and Node.js with Typescript. We’re still interested if you have equivalent experience in other general purpose programming languages. We work most often with relational databases like MySQL and event-streaming with Kafka. We’re still interested if you’ve used other persistence and adjacent technology like Redis, Postgres, DynamoDB, and ElasticSearch. Ownership mentality and can produce quality results with guidance Enjoy learning new technologies as they emerge Strong knowledge of computer science fundamentals: data structures and algorithms Experience with common software engineering tools such as Git, JIRA, Confluence, etc. Bachelor’s degree in computer science or comparable field, or equivalent self-study What you’ll do (Design & Development) Operate independently with assistance from more experienced developers as needed Participate in the full SDLC; including development, estimation, planning, and design applications Deliver moderately complex code solutions Contribute to overall system design, architecture, security, scalability, reliability, and performance of applications Build on experience working with Docker, Linux, AWS, Terraform, and APIs using REST and GraphQL. Support the build and deployment pipeline; may assist in diagnosing / solving production support issues Support technical design and delivery of complex features across multiple systems as H-E-B improves the user experience Help create documentation and training related to technology stacks and standards within assigned team Use / contribute to the refinement of Digital Engineering- related tools, standards, and training Engage / collaborate with external technical teams to ensure timely, high-quality solutions Engage with shared services teams and vendors when necessary Provide end-to-end support to applications Our Benefits Immediate eligibility for quarterly bonuses based on company performance A robust Benefits plan with coverage starting Day One 10% off H-E-B brand products in-store and online starting Day One Parental Leave for new parents, adoptions included Adoption Assistance Family Planning Assistance through Progyny’s fertility specialists Access to LGBTQ-focused healthcare concierge Access to H-E-B’s full service, affordable primary care practice H-E-B Wellness Primary Care Access to other savings (gyms, phone, hotels, and more) through an online discount program Flexible work opportunities including WFH and hybrid options About H-E-B H-E-B is one of the largest, independently owned food retailers in the nation operating over 400 stores throughout Texas and Mexico, with annual sales generating over $34 billion. Junior Software Engineer - job post Fathom5 Austin, TX 78754 • Hybrid remote Full-time Apply now Apply now save-icon Job details Job Type Full-time Fathom5 is an industrial technology company building security-first Brilliant Machines to accelerate Industry 4.0. Our work requires us to think critically , act boldly , and move quickly . We are looking for an enthusiastic Junior Software Engineer to join our software design team. You will report directly to the Fathom5 Chief Engineer and assist with all functions of software coding and design. Your primary focus will be to learn the codebase, learn Fathom5’s DevOps practices, develop code as part of small teams, and work with customers and users on feedback. We are looking for a curious, creative individual with a technical foundation who is naturally fascinated by the challenges and detail work in enabling industrial automation and has the technical capacity to systematically express their problem-solving ideas in contributing to our mission to Secure the Digital Future. The Fathom5 Junior Software Engineer will: Assist the Chief Engineer with all aspects of software design and coding. Attend and contribute to company development meetings, daily stand-up, and demo days. Learn the codebase and improve their coding skills. Write and maintain code. Work on bug fixes. Respond to requests from the development team. Write reports. Conduct development and integration tests. and will also have a working knowledge of: Command line tools Pulling and making commits Docker containers Microservice design patterns – making APIs, clusters, and containers The Fathom5 Junior Software Engineer position requires: Proficiency in multiple programming languages – Demonstrated experience and proficiency in at least two programming languages (GOLANG, Rust, C, and C++ preferred). Clear and effective communication – Written and oral communication skills sufficient to explain technical material to other team members. Quick learning – The ability and desire to learn new technologies swiftly. Team-first mentality – The ability and desire to work in a team environment. Startup Stamina – Fathom5 is changing the world at the intersection of industrial systems and advanced software. Sometimes changing the world requires long hours, standing for full days at events, and medical clearance for carrying computer equipment as well as occasional travel in support of our customers. This is an entry level position and will have these credentials: B.S./B.A. from an accredited four-year university in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or Electric Engineering with a CS focus Coding academy certifications also welcomed and accepted 0-2 years experience in a professional business environment At Fathom5, we believe that a diverse, equitable and inclusive workplace makes us a more relevant and resilient company. We welcome people from all backgrounds, ethnicities, cultures, and experiences. Fathom5 provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state, or local laws. We know that the impostor syndrome and confidence gap are real. Please do not hesitate to apply! Due to the sensitive nature of some of our projects, only US Citizens can be considered for employment at this time. No recruiters, please! If you require alternative methods of application or screening, you must approach the employer directly to request this as Indeed is not responsible for the employer's application process.

Our team brings payment solutions and associated services to clients around the globe. Our global clients and partners deploy our solutions to serve the needs of Small Businesses, Middle Market Clients, Large Corporate Clients, Multi Nationals and Governments. New Flows - Visa Direct team is looking for a Senior Software Engineer , we want to hear from you together, let's make Visa a great place to work. What's it all about? Common Purpose, Uncommon Opportunity. Everyone at Visa works with one goal in mind making sure that Visa is the best way to pay and be paid, for everyone everywhere. This is our global vision and the common purpose that unites the entire Visa team. As a global payments technology company, tech is at the heart of what we do: Our VisaNet network processes over 13,000 transactions per second for people and businesses around the world, enabling them to use digital currency instead of cash and checks. We are also global advocates for financial inclusion, working with partners around the world to help those who lack access to financial services join the global economy. Visa's sponsorships, including the Olympics and FIFA World Cup, celebrate teamwork, diversity, and excellence throughout the world. If you have a passion to make a difference in the lives of people around the world, Visa offers an uncommon opportunity to build a strong, thriving career. Visa is fueled by our team of talented employees who continuously raise the bar on delivering the convenience and security of digital currency to people all over the world. Join our team and find out how Visa is everywhere you want to be. Essential Functions You will be part of Visa’s New Flows - Visa Direct team which focuses on building Push Payment Solutions and providing technical expertise to our Clients during their integration phase. We are looking for a technically expert Software Engineer for our Client Integration Solution team based out of our Austin office to assure client success in using Visa Direct Product offerings This role requires quick troubleshooting and problem solving skills, logical thinking, and application of programming techniques to design, build, and maintain solution for clients. Deep knowledge of computer science fundamentals, mobile & web technologies, multi-tiered architecture and experience in tools development. In addition to the technical skill set and passion for learning new technology, the candidate will be a self-starter, results-driven, and equipped with excellent verbal and written communication skills to interface with external teams & stakeholders. The successful candidate will be able to lead Client integration efforts, provide technical leadership, work independently on multiple tasks, working very closely with the engineering leads, product manager, and client support teams. This is a hybrid position. Hybrid employees can alternate time between both remote and office. Employees in hybrid roles are expected to work from the office 2-3 set days a week (determined by leadership/site), with a general guidepost of being in the office 50% or more of the time based on business needs. Software Engineer - job post University of Texas at Austin 1,166 reviews 1616 Guadalupe St, Austin, TX 78701 $85,000 a year -  Full-time You must create an Indeed account before continuing to the company website to apply Apply on company site save-icon Job details Salary $85,000 a year Job Type Full-time Job Posting Title: Software Engineer - Hiring Department: Texas Advanced Computing Center - Position Open To: All Applicants - Weekly Scheduled Hours: 40 - FLSA Status: Exempt - Earliest Start Date: Immediately - Position Duration: Expected to Continue - Location: PICKLE RESEARCH CAMPUS - Job Details: General Notes The Texas Advanced Computing Center (TACC) at The University of Texas at Austin is one of the leading supercomputing centers in the world, supporting advances in computational research by thousands of researchers and students. This position will join TACC’s Advanced Computing Interfaces (ACI) department as part of the Web and Mobile Applications (WMA) team as a software developer with an opportunity to demonstrate and expand both your technical and soft skills. Our team is brought together with a shared belief in using our software engineering skills to add value to the world. We are a passionate and diverse team of Software Engineers, DevOps, Project Managers, and Support staff brought together to embody the vision of creating software to change the world. The Web and Mobile application team helps build science gateways – these are websites and the services that support them – used by the nation’s leading researchers. You get to apply your knowledge of software development to design, develop and implement custom web portal solutions and Science Gateways. You will work on software development tasks including front-, middle- and back-end tiers. This is a mid-level to senior developer position with an opportunity to work on full-stack skills. Joining the team, means you get to have a hand in a variety of software engineering processes and continually grow your skill set and work on interesting and innovative problems. The Texas Advanced Computing Center supports individuals from all communities by respecting and encouraging mindfulness of diverse viewpoints and experiences. We strive to promote diversity in our recruiting and retention practices as we believe inclusivity contributes to the development of excellence in all of our endeavors. TACC fosters a culture of innovation, passion, and fun by encouraging staff members to actively collaborate to investigate the latest technologies, team up for charities, and celebrate successes together. TACC promotes a healthy workplace by helping employees achieve balance between their personal and professional lives in order to increase employee engagement, job satisfaction, and overall well-being. Candidates will need to upload a resume, letter of interest, and the names of three references to apply for this position. UT Austin offers a competitive benefits package that includes: 100% employer-paid basic medical coverage Retirement contributions Paid vacation and sick time Paid holidays Please visit our Human Resources (HR) website to learn more about the total benefits offered. Selected candidate for this position must be eligible to work in the US on a full-time basis for any employer without sponsorship. Purpose The position will contribute to the design, development, and maintenance of web-based applications and web services. Responsibilities Use your software engineering skills to contribute to the design, development, and maintenance of web-based applications and web services. Have the skillset to architect, develop and deploy projects to production. Learn and adapt existing software projects to meet client needs, learn new software technologies as needed to meet the client needs and greater vision of the team. Demonstrates ability to work well both independently and in a team environment, work productively, and maintain a high quality of work. Follow appropriate priorities as set by project and manager, complete assignments on time or ahead of scheduled deadlines, in order of priority. Work involves overseeing or assisting in the development of strategic plans, goals and objectives for the development of information systems; establishing standards, policies and procedures for software systems development; establishing priorities, standards, and measurement tools for determining progress in meeting goals; and coordinating and evaluating program activities. Work also includes evaluating resource needs for the assignment of staff to projects and other development efforts, scheduling and analyzing user requirements; coordinating programming projects with the work of other staff; analyzing proposed computer applications; and providing technical assistance to staff. The SDS Supervisor is responsible for providing direction and guidance in strategic operations and planning. Works under limited supervision with considerable latitude for the use of initiative and independent judgment. May be called upon to work outside of normal business hours to sustain operations or complete urgent assignments. Some travel may be required. Essential Duties Ø Manages, plans, coordinates, and directs activities of assigned IT Section staff. Ø Implements, evaluates, and enforces guidelines, procedures, policies, rules, regulations for assigned IT Section staff. Ø Prioritizes, sets, and maintains workload expectations for daily IT operations, works on projects, service requests and IT roadmap initiatives in alignment with IT department’s human resource capacity. Ø Develops performance standards and position descriptions; provides input on IT Section training; plans, assigns and supervises the work of section staff; provides guidance and mentoring; recommends division personnel actions; and ensures accurate and timely appraisals and meaningful training and developmental opportunities for each employee under direct supervision. Coaches, counsels, and mentors their IT Section staff to optimize performance, productivity, support CIO succession planning, and ensure uninterrupted business continuity. Ø Oversees and organizes their assigned IT Section to align with workload demands, fill vacancies, sustain operations, and operate within IT department budget to achieve desired outcomes and measurable goals; and monitors and evaluates the effectiveness and efficiency of staffing levels. Ø Directs their IT Section staff and/or coordinates with other IT Section Managers regarding the Department’s licensing information systems, software development, Quality Assurance and Accessibility (QA), Security Vulnerability Assessment (SVA), Database Administration, reporting mechanisms, helpdesk activities, and other software platforms. Ø In accordance with Agency policy, defines and implements goals and objectives to provide staff with regular feedback on performance and in understanding management expectations. Ø Establishes mechanisms and procedures to gather information on throughput, quality, unit performance, and reporting metrics for inclusion on the IT Dashboard(s) and to demonstrate value to customers. Ø Develops operating and monitoring guidelines, policies, procedures, accountability standards, and instructions for staff, contractors and customers of their assigned IT Section. Ø Assists in the development, review, and implementation of techniques for evaluating Division, IT Section, and program activities. Ø Attends, represents the Department/IT, and participates in meetings, hearings, conferences, conventions, and seminars, and/or boards, panels, and committees as necessary. Ø Defines and maintains a reliable, predictable work schedule for themself and their IT Section staff. Ø Identifies areas needing improvement, coordinates with appropriate agency staff to address deficiencies, and makes recommendations to improve Agency, Division, and IT Section operations. Ø Provides technical guidance as needed regarding Department systems and services. Ø Oversees the preparation of management and productivity reports, research, and studies. Ø Oversees projects that cross functional agency systems and other state entities that require coordinating, planning, and scheduling during project development and implementation stages. Ø Evaluates, recommends, and implements packaged software, Software as a Service and hosted software solutions to address agency business requirements when appropriate. Ø Defines artifacts for and promotes/enforces the Department’s Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC) standards and procedures for the development and maintenance of highly complex software application systems. This includes programming standards, procedures and recommendations to improve programming activities for development staff. Ø Manages agency’s software related help desk requests and oversees technical assistance for agency applications development and related software platforms. Ø Assists the CIO in developing and evaluating IT budget requests, and Agency strategic planning initiatives. Monitors IT budget expenditures and recommends adjustments. Ø Assists in the preparation of various technical mandated reports, such as the Information Services Strategic Plan, the Biennial Operating Plan for Information Resources, the contracted Disaster Recovery Plan for the agency, Information Services components of the Agency Business Continuity Plan and other reports with applications development impact. Ø Coordinates with the ePMO to provide Executive, division directors, and other key stakeholders status updates and progress of Software Development Services team’s projects. Ø Ensures compliance with all relevant Federal, State, and agency laws, rules, policies, and procedures. Ø Works to establish and maintain IT Division’s values, operating principles and a culture of accountability, teamwork, effective communication, excellence, ingenuity, and innovation to promote an image of IT excellence. Ø Collaborates closely and effectively with CIO, other Software Development Services Managers, and IT-related managers to provide clear, unambiguous strategies and tactics regarding IT matters. Ø Assists with internal audits. Ø May serve as backup to other IT Managers, Deputy IT Director/IT Services Director CIO. Ø Complies with division and/or agency training requirements. Ø Keeps management appropriately informed of ongoing activity and critical matters affecting the operation and well-being of the agency. Ø Demonstrates a spirit of teamwork, offering positive and constructive ideas, encouragement, and support to other members of the staff and team, while upholding the Agency’s core values. Position Description: We are searching for a highly experienced Release Manager that will own and manage the entire process of quarterly release cycles across a suite of enterprise products. The position is required to have a deep understanding of agile processes, be a detail-oriented planner, and have a high degree of comfort interacting and communicating with all levels of the organization. This position will interface with all business units on a regular basis, including not limited to, Development, IT operations, QA, PMO, and Product Management. This position will work in coordination with another Release Manager within the portfolio to manage major quarterly releases and provide oversight to minor releases at a more frequent cadence. Day-to Day-Duties and Responsibilities: Forward planning of quarterly release cycles for multiple enterprise products Identifying, scheduling, and coordinating code deployments through development, test, and production environments Identifying and managing risks and resolving issues that affect release scope, schedule, and quality Coordinating and negotiating release content based on groomed and prioritized product backlog, dependencies, and constraints Collaborating with various groups to optimize the delivery of release content based on quality and delivered value Conducting release readiness reviews, including assisting project managers with ensuring required release documentation is complete and accurate Participating in and presenting at Change Advisory Board (CAB) for deployment approval Developing and maintaining release schedules for all core products Reporting, monitoring, and communicating on release status, including identifying any changes to scope, schedule, cost Leading and coordinating all release activities for a given quarterly release Driving teams to ensure adherence to schedules, scope, and quality Communicating and reporting to senior management on status of release cycle What You Bring to the Team: It’s an important role that covers many skills. We’re seeking applicants with Bachelor’s Degree in Business, Communications or similar field or equivalent related experience plus six (6) of more years’ experience. Possesses proven track record of managing release cycles across enterprise products and portfolios and has a collaborative work style to drive success leveraging experience with Agile Scrum and Scaled Agile Framework (SAFe) methods The ideal candidate has worked in the financial technology space and is an experienced leader. Experience with the following companies and/or products is preferred: Finastra – CME and LoanIQ, Encompass – Ellie Mae, Microsoft – CRM Dynamics, Fidelity Information Systems – Optimist, Floify, and/or CSI.as. AWS Certified Solutions Architect is preferred. Problem-solving attitude. Collaborative team spirit. We believe diverse skills, abilities, viewpoints, and backgrounds make for a better product, better problem-solving and a better work environment. We hire for potential, passion for our mission, and a knack for solving difficult problems over checking every qualification box. Software Developer-Computer Science - job post Codeware Inc 4 reviews Austin, TX 78730 Full-time Apply now Apply now save-icon Job details Job Type Full-time Position: Software Developer with Computer Science background Functional Area: Product Development Location: Austin, Texas Company Overview Codeware develops and markets COMPRESS, an engineering software application for Windows. COMPRESS is used by Engineers worldwide to design pressure vessels and heat exchangers in compliance with the rules of the American Society of Mechanical Engineers (ASME) Boiler Pressure Vessel Code. The ASME Code is an internationally recognized standard used to ensure the safety of a broad range of pressurized equipment. The ASME Code, and therefore COMPRESS, finds application in a wide variety of industries including petrochemical, nuclear, pulp and paper and, most recently, biofuels. Compliance with the provisions of the ASME Code is a legislative requirement of virtually all jurisdictions in the U.S and Canada. Codeware provides a competitive salary and benefits package to all full-time employees. Position Description Codeware is seeking a full-time Software Developer to join our Austin-based Software Development Team. The successful candidate will have a computer software or information systems background. They will be a part of Codeware’s team of professionals engaged in the development of our state-of-the art pressure vessel and heat exchanger design software, COMPRESS. Position Responsibilities Design, code, integrate, test, and maintain application and related documentation. Write algorithms for the mechanical design of pressure vessels. During the design phase, test code for functionality and optimize for performance to insure the code meets project standards. Assist with developing quality assurance pre-release testing plan. Assist in the creation of graphical 3-D modeling of pressure vessels (industrial process equipment). Assess adequacy of existing code. Review existing code for the project and recommend modifications for upgrading and improvement. Position Requirements Skills / Qualifications Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science. 3-5 years software development experience. An understanding of object oriented design concepts. Strong experience in C/C++ and related technologies, Visual BASIC an asset. Programming experience (code design, writing, testing, debugging and documenting). Experience with .Net Framework (C#, VB.Net). Skilled at reading and comprehending established source code. Experience working with the following an asset: 3D Computer Aided Design APIs SVN (code repository) Redmine (project management) MS Visual Studio 2005 Strong mathematical background an asset. Committed to professional advancement through continuous learning. Characteristics Good communications skills. Excellent organizational skills, detail oriented. GENERAL DESCRIPTION This is a remote position in Texas. Our mission at the Texas Department of Motor Vehicles (TxDMV) is to serve, protect and advance the citizens and industries in the state with quality motor vehicle related services. We are a dynamic state agency dedicated to customer service, consumer protection and the success of motor vehicle-related industries. Performs highly complex (senior-level) web-based programming and design in support of the Texas Department of Motor Vehicles (TxDMV), Information Technology (IT). Develops and maintains the operational, technical, and support requirements for the TxDMV's Internet and Intranet websites and web-based applications. Works with web content experts and graphic designers external to IT to identify publishable content, and develops, implements, and maintains the technical infrastructure to display and manage this content for the Internet and Intranet. Supports and maintains the content management system and transport mechanisms. Publishes content to the TxDMV public website (Internet) and Intranet. Experience using, patching, and maintaining content management systems. Works under limited supervision, with considerable latitude for the use of initiative and independent judgment. ESSENTIAL DUTIES Develops, implements, and maintains TxDMV's Internet/Intranet websites and web-based applications; defines website objectives and solutions by analyzing user requirements and envisioning system features and functionality. Designs and develops user interfaces to Internet/Intranet applications conforming to TxDMV's standards for look and feel; sets and meets expectations and features priorities throughout the development life cycle. Participates in code walk throughs and reviews. Designs, conducts, participates, and/or assists in website testing. Recommends system solutions by comparing advantages and disadvantages of custom development, open source, and vendor purchase alternatives. Integrates web applications by designing database architecture and server scripting; studies and establishes connectivity with network systems, search engines, and information servers as required. Creates multimedia applications using appropriate authoring tools; maintains and supports standard content management system. Develops, implements, and supports secure Web Services using appropriate technologies. Completes applications development by coordinating requirements, schedules, and activities with stakeholders; contributes to team meetings. Works with web content experts and graphic designers to incorporate their work into website and determines operational, technical, and support requirements for operation and maintenance of databases, text, and graphics. Monitors website usage; provides non-standard business hour trouble-shooting expertise to diagnose website and web-application production problems. Assists with implementation of security measures for websites. Performs other job-related duties as assigned. Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities Extensive knowledge of Knowledge of web design and development Thorough knowledge of SOA principles, practices and application Open Source software including, but not limited to, Java Enterprise Edition (J2EE), LAMP Framework (Linux, Apache/Tomcat, MySQL, PHP), DRUPAL, etc. Web Services programming, implementation, and supporting concepts and techniques Computer graphic software Considerable knowledge of Web content accessibility standards and guidelines; W3C WCAG 2.0 (Web Content Accessibility Guidelines) or ISO/IEC 40500 Working knowledge of Limitations & capabilities of computer systems; network layers & computer platforms; network operations support; operating systems; Internet technologies; databases; security applications; and information security practices, procedures, & regulations Expert skill in Handling multiple tasks and projects Analyzing issues, facts and available information to develop logical solutions; researching inconsistencies of facts or data; drawing correct inferences from information and making recommendations that support business decisions Web design and use of applicable development tools for web structures Other Attributes Maintains composure when handling problems, stressful situations, continuous change or unexpected developments Effective communication skills presenting sensitive information in a clear, concise, organized and interesting manner to various types and sizes of audiences. ADDITIONAL INFORMATION Job offer and continuation of employment is contingent upon: Proof of education and experience listed on the application. Eligibility to work in the United States. Satisfactory results from a pre-employment criminal history background check and driver’s record check. Compliance with Selective Service registration for males ages 18-25. Veterans: If selected for the position the following must be provided for proof of veterans’ preference: Veteran must provide form DD 214 Surviving Spouse or Orphan must provide DD 1300 or DD 214. Military Occupational Specialty (MOS) codes that may correspond to the state classification title for this position are listed on the State Auditor’s Office Job Descriptions; click on the occupational category for the position. Additional MOS can be found at the State Auditor’s Office Military Crosswalk Guide. The Texas Veterans Commission provides helpful employment information. Submission of Application: Your application should be complete and reflect all relevant education and experience. Omission of data can be the basis for disqualification; "See Resume" is not accepted in lieu of a completed online State of Texas application. Resumes may not be submitted in lieu of a completed State of Texas employment application, but may be considered as additional supplemental information. The resume must include employer name and dates of employment for relevant work experience to be considered by the hiring authority. AN EQUAL OPPORTUNITY/AFFIRMATIVE ACTION EMPLOYER The Texas Department of Motor Vehicles is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, disability, religion, gender, national origin, age, sexual orientation, veteran’s status, genetic information or protected activity. The TxDMV provides accommodations for persons with disabilities in accordance with the American with Disabilities Act. If you need help with the employment process or require other accommodations, please contact the Human Resources office for assistance at 512-465-4043. Qualifications MINIMUM REQUIREMENTS Education and Experience Bachelor’s degree from an accredited college or university or the U.S. equivalency thereof in computer science, computer information systems, management information systems, or a related field, plus three (3) years of experience developing and supporting website, web-based software applications, and administration of websites. Experience and education may be substituted for one another. (Education requirements may be satisfied by full-time experience or the prorated part-time equivalent.)

Introduction Paragraph: The Texas Higher Education Coordinating Board (THECB) is seeking a System Analyst / Programmer to work in the Information Solutions and Services (ISS) division. This person will have the opportunity to work in a dynamic environment where creative problem-solving, teamwork, communication, leadership and coding skills will be used to develop information technology systems. The selected candidate will be part of a team of systems analysts / programmers, quality assurance specialists, and project managers who develop and support mission-critical information systems that support the agency's mission to ensure that Texas higher education students are able to successfully obtain their education goals. General Description: Performs highly complex computer programming and systems analysis work in an application development environment for the Information Solutions and Services Division of the Texas Higher Education Coordinating Board (THECB). Work involves analyzing user requirements, procedures, and problems to automate processing to improve existing systems. Develops, tests, analyzes, and debugs agency applications following industry best practices while meeting business requirements. Works under limited supervision, with considerable latitude for the use of initiative and independent judgment. This position reports to the Director of Applications Development and Support. General Duties and Responsibilities: Designs, develops, modifies, implements, maintains, and supports assigned web-based applications. Analyzes, reviews, and revises programs to increase operating efficiency or to adapt to new procedures. Assists in the development of technology solutions to address automation needs and delivers quality implementation of defined solutions to facilitate realization of organizational benefits. Performs technical analysis work for proposed projects, new developments, or modifications/enhancements to existing systems. Designs, modifies, and implements new or revised systems to serve new purposes or improve workflow. Participates in scoping/feasibility discussions and proposes solutions using the assigned product framework. Implements measures to safeguard agency information. Provides computer programming and system analysis expertise in analyzing, documenting, maintaining, designing, developing, testing, and implementing applications. Completes simple to complex support tickets, including troubleshooting and correcting coding errors/issues. Analyzes and creates structured, well-documented programs and systems appropriate to those programs and systems that may be maintained by others. Ensures customer needs are properly translated into system requirements and design. Conducts testing to verify the accuracy of programming logic and ensure compliance with development standards and system/business requirements. Provides status updates on work assignments and any technical issues that present risk(s) to project timeline as required by selected project framework. Recommends and promotes secure coding practices for assigned product applications to reduce vulnerabilities. Assists in forecasting requirements for system and computer applications. Provides support in identifying, escalating to appropriate agency personnel and resolving issues with systems and applications. Assists in the resolution of escalated issues and disputes according to agency practices and policy. Develops and maintains expertise in programing tools, including staying current on the latest technology updates and development techniques. Analyzes system development life cycle (SDLC) processes and identifies issues and opportunities for continuous improvement. May analyze and define agency disaster recovery responsibilities and procedures for assigned products and applications. Works closely with the THECB’s Information Security team, peer developers, and analysts to perform technical analysis and assess business requirements. May perform periodic risk assessments on agency applications and initiates risk control strategies accordingly. Interacts with program managers, vendors, and other system analysts to ensure requirements are met and work products are appropriately reviewed and validated. Applies appropriate Family Educational Rights and Privacy Act (FERPA) standards at all times. Ensures compliance with federal, state, and agency Web Accessibility policies and procedures. Performs other duties as assigned. Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities: Knowledge of principles, practices, and techniques used in assigned product programming and system analysis. Knowledge of programming or scripting languages (SQL, ColdFusion, HTML, SML, Javascript, JQuery, C#.Net) Skill in using personal computers, databases, and general office software, including Microsoft Word, Outlook, PowerPoint, Excel. Skill in building and modifying web applications to meet business requirements. Ability to recognize, analyze, and resolve complex technical issues. Ability to take initiative, work independently, and make decisions using sound judgement. Ability to apply creative solutions when problem solving while keeping management informed of risks and critical issues. Ability to establish and maintain effective working relationships with coworkers and to work cooperatively and effectively in a team environment. Ability to communicate with customers to determine programming needs. Ability to translate customer requirements into application designs and systems requirements. Ability to communicate complex information in a in a clear, organized, concise, professional, and courteous way with individuals from diverse social, ethnic, economic, and cultural backgrounds in both spoken and written forms. Ability to plan, organize, and effectively manage and complete multiple priorities and projects concurrently. Ability to meet periodic, milestone, and final deadlines and to keep management abreast of issues. Ability to plan, set appropriate goals and objectives, and carry out work in a timely and effective manner. Ability to adhere to the agency’s internal management policies and procedures. Six additional months of relevant full-time work experience may substitute for 15 semester credit hours of required education, up to four years. Experience in ensuring Web accessibility compliance for new and pre-existing technology solutions, including 508 and WCAG 2.0AA.
